commit.message:
Fix extra new line when customising gemfiles (#222)

When using `customize_gemfiles`, two new line characters end up being
inserted after the block comment, but it should only be one. This trims
out the output to remove it.

Fixes #216.

verification.payload:
tree 3b029f2f33ab630e5f1b656a9a9dc83e246edefa
parent 2338a1edb23476510b83b591ff20056d4cc30b8f
author Joe Sharp <joe.sharp@procore.com> 1711451154 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711451154 +0000

Fix extra new line when customising gemfiles (#222)

When using `customize_gemfiles`, two new line characters end up being
inserted after the block comment, but it should only be one. This trims
out the output to remove it.

Fixes #216.

commit.message:
Avoid using the `--without` parameter to Bundler (#221)

Much like `--path` (#220), we want to avoid using deprecated arguments.
We're only using these in our tests, too.

This change has the downside of removing the positive check -- it's
possible that `orange_juice`, `coffee`, `soda` could not be included in
the output whilst the feature itself fails.

verification.payload:
tree 031f2dfc4fa2532851c12e7f0735dd44ff00c347
parent dba2b37132bf7d29084f4246e84e31129d179715
author Nick Charlton <nick@nickcharlton.net> 1708950882 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708950882 +0000

Avoid using the `--without` parameter to Bundler (#221)

Much like `--path` (#220), we want to avoid using deprecated arguments.
We're only using these in our tests, too.

This change has the downside of removing the positive check -- it's
possible that `orange_juice`, `coffee`, `soda` could not be included in
the output whilst the feature itself fails.

commit.message:
Avoid using the `--path` parameter to Bundler (#220)

This has been deprecated in favour of setting the value via `config`
instead. It was causing a deprecation warning and it's expected that
it'll be removed in Bundler v3.

https://bundler.io/v2.5/man/bundle-config.1.html#REMEMBERING-OPTIONS

verification.payload:
tree ea7827a09ffa7ded42c394ca949f79922e2e8825
parent 08247f8d29e0f7219421f846d9ff65f149f81a8a
author Nick Charlton <nick@nickcharlton.net> 1708950855 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708950855 +0000

Avoid using the `--path` parameter to Bundler (#220)

This has been deprecated in favour of setting the value via `config`
instead. It was causing a deprecation warning and it's expected that
it'll be removed in Bundler v3.

https://bundler.io/v2.5/man/bundle-config.1.html#REMEMBERING-OPTIONS

commit.message:
Add support for `ruby file:` Gemfile syntax (#219)

Previously, this would yield an error:

    appraise "foo" do
      ruby file: '../.ruby-version'

      gem "faraday-follow_redirects", "0.3.0"
    end

`Appraisal::BundlerDSL#ruby_version` is emitting a block when the
Gemfile DSL ruby method is used. Currently, this is emitted, which is
not a method argument but rather a block:

    ruby {:file=>"../.ruby-version"}

To fix this, we need to add `()` to ensure the arguments stay arguments:

    ruby({:file=>"../.ruby-version"})

This has been tested on Bundler 2.3.27 only — at this point in time we
have compatibility issues with others.

https://github.com/thoughtbot/appraisal/issues/218

verification.payload:
tree c3be13d317c648cdd37f396536c59a71417d54fd
parent 7d26791756ab627d7b3faca5f18d1229b1187be7
author Sebastian Cohnen <tisba@users.noreply.github.com> 1708008378 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708008378 +0000

Add support for `ruby file:` Gemfile syntax (#219)

Previously, this would yield an error:

    appraise "foo" do
      ruby file: '../.ruby-version'

      gem "faraday-follow_redirects", "0.3.0"
    end

`Appraisal::BundlerDSL#ruby_version` is emitting a block when the
Gemfile DSL ruby method is used. Currently, this is emitted, which is
not a method argument but rather a block:

    ruby {:file=>"../.ruby-version"}

To fix this, we need to add `()` to ensure the arguments stay arguments:

    ruby({:file=>"../.ruby-version"})

This has been tested on Bundler 2.3.27 only — at this point in time we
have compatibility issues with others.

https://github.com/thoughtbot/appraisal/issues/218

commit.message:
Fix missing source deprecation warning (#207)

This just adds a source to our template, fixing:

    [DEPRECATED] This Gemfile does not include an explicit global
    source. Not using an explicit global source may result in a
    different lockfile being generated depending on the gems you have
    installed locally before bundler is run. Instead, define a global
    source in your Gemfile like this: source "https://rubygems.org".

commit.message:
Fix relativizing directory on non-path remotes (#205)

Appraisal was creating invalid lock files, because paths weren't being
relatived correctly. e.g.:

    remote: https://github.com/thoughtbot..raisal

Instead of:

    remote: https://github.com/thoughtbot/appraisal

This PR solves this issue by replacing only the absolute paths that are
preceded by a space.

verification.payload:
tree 1f39290bea344c0800ff67bbe8dc3931454435e2
parent 0c855ae0da89fec74b4d1a01801c55b0e72496d4
author aymeric-ledorze <aymeric.ledorze@kosmopolead.com> 1675708202 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1675708202 +0000

Fix relativizing directory on non-path remotes (#205)

Appraisal was creating invalid lock files, because paths weren't being
relatived correctly. e.g.:

    remote: https://github.com/thoughtbot..raisal

Instead of:

    remote: https://github.com/thoughtbot/appraisal

This PR solves this issue by replacing only the absolute paths that are
preceded by a space.

commit.message:
Switch to using Bundler.with_original_env (#202)

This fixes a long-running issue with more recent Bundler versions and
compatibility with GitHub Actions (and other CI services), where the
environment wasn't being handled correctly.

Introduce a new 'APPRAISAL_UNDER_TEST' environment variable that
`Command` uses to determine if Appraisal itself is under test, and if
so, tweaks the environment in the way the tests require. This allows the
tests to pass while using `Bundler.with_original_env`.

Fixes #173

Co-authored-by: Kyle Fazzari <kyrofa@ubuntu.com>
Co-authored-by: Chris Oliver <excid3@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 6501af7142358085aae691043368356d291c956f
parent 40956d3ae82632d211f157fcd289402e8f525335
author Kyle Fazzari <kyrofa@ubuntu.com> 1674840930 -0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1674840930 +0000

Switch to using Bundler.with_original_env (#202)

This fixes a long-running issue with more recent Bundler versions and
compatibility with GitHub Actions (and other CI services), where the
environment wasn't being handled correctly.

Introduce a new 'APPRAISAL_UNDER_TEST' environment variable that
`Command` uses to determine if Appraisal itself is under test, and if
so, tweaks the environment in the way the tests require. This allows the
tests to pass while using `Bundler.with_original_env`.

Fixes #173

Co-authored-by: Kyle Fazzari <kyrofa@ubuntu.com>
Co-authored-by: Chris Oliver <excid3@gmail.com>

commit.message:
Fix `__FILE__` and `__dir__` in primary Gemfiles (#193)

Gemfile classes call instance_eval without telling Ruby what file the string
came from, and so Ruby thinks that FILE should point to
`appraisal/lib/appraisal/gemfile.rb` instead of the Gemfile itself, and that breaks
anything inside the Gemfile that references either __FILE__ or __dir__.

This fixes the case where `ruby Pathname.new(__dir__).join(".ruby-version").read`
is used in the original `Gemfile` across Appraisals.

verification.payload:
tree dd81530aa5cdcbbd0c2fdab582658d4fb3357934
parent 2f5be65b8e127bd602fd149f395f2f8fa50616a8
author André Arko <andre@arko.net> 1643891194 -0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1643891194 +0000

Fix `__FILE__` and `__dir__` in primary Gemfiles (#193)

Gemfile classes call instance_eval without telling Ruby what file the string
came from, and so Ruby thinks that FILE should point to
`appraisal/lib/appraisal/gemfile.rb` instead of the Gemfile itself, and that breaks
anything inside the Gemfile that references either __FILE__ or __dir__.

This fixes the case where `ruby Pathname.new(__dir__).join(".ruby-version").read`
is used in the original `Gemfile` across Appraisals.

commit.message:
Add ability to remove gem from appraisal (#171)

This is adding the ability to use the remove_gem declaration
within an appraise block. By doing so the gem will be dropped
from the generated Gemfile. This is useful in cases where an
appraisal require the removal of old dependencies that are still
used by the mainline source.

verification.payload:
tree 8e625bc4e1e2403354ab91d1258e23fe0e752738

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1604921750 +0000

Add ability to remove gem from appraisal (#171)

This is adding the ability to use the remove_gem declaration
within an appraise block. By doing so the gem will be dropped
from the generated Gemfile. This is useful in cases where an
appraisal require the removal of old dependencies that are still
used by the mainline source.

commit.message:
Allow specifying the `path` option to bundler (#165)

The `path` option is often used to cache dependencies on CI, and this
causing projects like [Administrate][1] to do unnecessary work.

It's important that we pass the absolute file path to `--path`, as
otherwise it's assumed to be inside the `gemfiles` directory when run.

[1]: https://github.com/thoughtbot/administrate/pull/1482

verification.payload:
tree 22f1848dfed198a8d597aba036c341ec29becd9c
parent ef6cd6ad2c1a93b997fe8b48fefe9a5aa75d9a3b
author Nick Charlton <nick@nickcharlton.net> 1581776435 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1581776435 +0000

Allow specifying the `path` option to bundler (#165)

The `path` option is often used to cache dependencies on CI, and this
causing projects like [Administrate][1] to do unnecessary work.

It's important that we pass the absolute file path to `--path`, as
otherwise it's assumed to be inside the `gemfiles` directory when run.

[1]: https://github.com/thoughtbot/administrate/pull/1482

commit.message:
Make git_source work in nested groups (#160)

If you declare a `git_source` at the top level of your Gemfile or a spec in
Appraisals, it will substitute the gem source in `gem` declarations. If you
want to use those gem sources in nested groups declared with `group`,
`platforms`, `platform`, `source`, `git`, or `path`, the `git_source`
declarations from the top level aren't inherited, so they don't work like they
do with bundler.

Fortunately, in `BundlerDSL` there's a protected `git_sources` writer, and all
the groups are also declared in that file. It should be easy enough to assign
all of the group objects to a copy of the `git_sources`. That would make the
substitutions work.

Fixes #159.

verification.payload:
tree 54a7918f0dca7118c8d3083d41f2abb9be3b905a
parent 92d5134994003d6f17e874117483bac7e8fb7829
author Brian Hawley <brian_hawley@yahoo.com> 1581344495 -0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1581344495 +0000

Make git_source work in nested groups (#160)

If you declare a `git_source` at the top level of your Gemfile or a spec in
Appraisals, it will substitute the gem source in `gem` declarations. If you
want to use those gem sources in nested groups declared with `group`,
`platforms`, `platform`, `source`, `git`, or `path`, the `git_source`
declarations from the top level aren't inherited, so they don't work like they
do with bundler.

Fortunately, in `BundlerDSL` there's a protected `git_sources` writer, and all
the groups are also declared in that file. It should be easy enough to assign
all of the group objects to a copy of the `git_sources`. That would make the
substitutions work.

Fixes #159.

commit.message:
Drop MRI 1.8.7-2.2 support (#158)

* Remove deprecated TravisCI config
    - this is currently a noop.
* Remove MRI 1.8.7 support
* Remove MRI 1.9 support
* Remove MRI 2.0.0 support
* Remove MRI 2.1 support
* Remove MRI 2.2 support
* Remove rbx-3 from TravisCI matrix
    - it doesn't even install.
